benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/allCustomFields - Retrieve account customFields

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05) verify successful retrievals with different combinations of parameters.
Empty Response: TC06 and TC07 validate behavior when no custom fields exist or no matches are found.

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage for objectType and audit parameters including valid-enum sweeps (TC08, TC09), invalid formats (TC32), extra/unsupported params (TC10), and whitespace/edge cases (TC36).
Authentication/Authorization (basic): Missing and invalid token scenarios are covered (TC14, TC15) and ensure 401 handling.
Error handling for identifiers: Invalid format, non-existent, empty, whitespace and overly long accountId cases are present (TC12, TC13, TC33, TC34, TC35).
Security tests: SQL injection (TC17) and XSS (TC18) tests are present to check input sanitization and leakage of sensitive info.
Resiliency and retries: Service unavailable and retry/recovery scenarios are covered (TC16, TC20, TC39); dependency failure for audit service is covered (TC23).
Performance/load: High-volume and concurrent request scenarios are present (TC11, TC25, TC26) including time/throughput expectations and resource utilization.
Edge cases & regressions: Single-value and maximum-value edge cases and regression checks for audit handling and backward compatibility are included (TC29, TC30, TC21, TC22).
Accessibility and descriptive errors: Accessibility structure and descriptive messages for errors are covered (TC37, TC38).
gaps: Pagination: No tests exercise pagination parameters or behavior (limit/offset, page tokens) or the absence/presence of pagination headers when dataset is large.
Caching Behavior / HTTP headers: No scenarios assert Content-Type, Cache-Control, ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified, or behavior on conditional requests (304 Not Modified).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: Although concurrency/performance tests exist, there are no explicit tests for rate limiting behavior (throttling responses, 429 handling, Retry-After header).
Authorization nuances: Tests only cover 401 (missing/invalid token). There are no tests for 403 (forbidden) or role/permission-based access restrictions.

Server-side error variety: Only 503 and some transient errors are covered; there is no explicit coverage for 500/Internal Server Error scenarios caused by e.g., DB exceptions, malformed server payloads, or other 5xx variants.
Response headers and content negotiation: Tests do not verify response Content-Type, charset, or Accept header negotiation.
Pagination edge cases & consistency: No checks for correctness when the number of items equals exact page sizes, off-by-one, or consistency across paged reads.
Rate-limit recovery: No tests for client/backoff behavior when receiving 429s or for server-side rate-limit counters/state.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: include endpoints/params for limit/offset/page-size/page-token, verify correct subsets of data, boundary conditions (exact page size, +1), and presence/semantics of pagination headers.
Add caching and conditional request tests: assert Content-Type, Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified; test If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since flows and 304 responses to reduce load.
Add explicit rate-limiting tests: simulate many rapid requests to verify 429 responses, Retry-After header, and client/backoff expectations (also assert server behavior under throttling).
Expand authorization tests: add 403 / permission-denied scenarios for users lacking required roles/scopes, and test anonymous vs authenticated vs insufficient-permission tokens.
Add broader 5xx error simulations: test 500 Internal Server Error and database failure modes to ensure safe/consistent error messages and monitoring hooks.
Verify response headers and content negotiation: assert application/json content-type, charset, and behavior when Accept header requests other formats.
Add pagination consistency and large-dataset integrity checks: ensure results are stable across repeated paged requests and not subject to race conditions during concurrent writes.

Add test assertions on schema-level details for returned CustomField objects (required properties, data types, nullability, and default values such as audit default NONE) and explicit negative tests for malformed query params beyond enum-checks.
